intro: Arthrophyllum kjellbergii, commonly known as the Kjellberg's arthrophyllum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in coastal and sandy environments. The plant is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Arthrophyllum kjellbergii is typically found in coastal dunes and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils.
